pullrequest.title: adding some pre-generated task worlds to simplify basic testing

content.raw: I don’t have the full environment here at home, so I can’t test it directly, but is it required to have both the .xacro and .world files in the repository?  Looking at the run\_trial.bash script, it looks like only the .world files are necessary - true?
content.html: I don’t have the full environment here at home, so I can’t test it directly, but is it required to have both the .xacro and .world files in the repository? Looking at the run_trial.bash script, it looks like only the .world files are necessary - true?

pullrequest.title: adding some pre-generated task worlds to simplify basic testing

content.raw:
Revisiting this.

I still agree with the premise - we would like to be able to have way for teams to to test their image.  This was certainly a sticking point for VRX19.  

For me, running the recommended test tutorial would be a good amount of work.

1. Can @{557058:4ded1ddf-947e-4154-bbd1-3dba24f1bdbd} easily test?
2. If testing isn’t easy, I think it would be fine to approve and merge without running the test independently.  This process will likely change for VRX21 and I we will definitely retest everything before releasing to teams.

“A good engineer is a lazy engineer”

‌
content.html:
Revisiting this.

I still agree with the premise - we would like to be able to have way for teams to to test their image. This was certainly a sticking point for VRX19.

For me, running the recommended test tutorial would be a good amount of work.

  1. Can @Carlos Agüero easily test?
  2. If testing isn’t easy, I think it would be fine to approve and merge without running the test independently. This process will likely change for VRX21 and I we will definitely retest everything before releasing to teams.

“A good engineer is a lazy engineer”

‌

pullrequest.title: adding some pre-generated task worlds to simplify basic testing

content.raw: I agree that it could be convenient to offer a set of generated worlds here. We can always revisit it for VRX’21, as we probably don’t need al xacro files.
content.html: I agree that it could be convenient to offer a set of generated worlds here. We can always revisit it for VRX’21, as we probably don’t need al xacro files.
